page.title: 03Mowsley & Laughton Buildings
page.content: Both villages have an Anglican{church; St.Nicholas'in Mowsley is a 13th century stone building; St. Luke's Laughton, founded in the 14th century, was rebuilt in the 18th century.St. Helen's church,Gumley,is also in this block. Mowsley has a Wesleyan{chapel} dated 1879. The congregational chapel (1839) has just been made into a house. Laughton's Wesleyan chapel (1859) is now part of Home Farm. All are of red brick. Mowsley's Primary School,built in 1864,has 21 pupils. Laughton's school was closed by 1900, and used as a village hall for a time.Mowsley's village hall,a former army hut,was opened in 1924. The only pub,The Staff of Life,is in Mowsley.It is of brick and was built in the 1930's.Laughton has 2{council houses,}Mowsley has 6;3 of them now privately owned.
